education_text.0: Tom Michael Mitchell (born August 9, 1951) is an American computer scientist and the Founders University Professor at      Carnegie Mellon University Carnegie Mellon University (CMU)Tom Michael Mitchell (born August 9, 1951) is an American computer scientist and the Founders University Professor at      Carnegie Mellon University Carnegie Mellon University (CMU)Mitchell began his teaching career at      Rutgers University Rutgers University in 1978Mitchell began his teaching career at      Rutgers University Rutgers University in 1978He was elected into the      National Academy of Engineering United States National Academy of Engineering in 2010  for pioneering contributions and leadership in the methods and applications of machine learningMitchell is a prolific author of scientific works on various topics in computer science, including machine learning, artificial intelligence, robotics, and cognitive neuroscience
